input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
The device, drive letter or a mount point of the volume to be defragmented.
Analyzes the volume/filesystem in read-only mode. Valid value: true

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/sbin/e2fsck</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${device}')!=0 and '${analyize}' != 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -p</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${device}')!=0 and '${analyize}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -n</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> $[device]</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/sbin/fsck</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${device}')!=0 and '${analyize}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -n</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> $[device]</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">defrag $[device]</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${device}')!=0 and '${analyize}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /a</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Perform Disk Defrag Locates and consolidates fragmented boot files, data files, and folders on specified volumes.
